metadata.title: CVE-2022-2879 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Reader.Read does not set a limit on the maximum size of file headers. Amaliciously crafted archive could cause Read to allocate unbounded amountsof memory, potentially causing resource exhaustion or panics. After fix,Reader.Read limits the maximum size of header blocks to 1 MiB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2879` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
No subscription required

golang-1.13 - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

golang-1.16 - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1
golang-1.16-go - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1
golang-1.16-src - 1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: golang-1.18 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4').
golang-1.13 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.8-1ubuntu1~18.04.4+esm1').
golang-1.16 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.2-0ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1').
golang-1.10 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.8 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.9 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
